title: installation issue: intel-mkl
body:
It seems like `intel-mkl` needs the command line program `cpio` in order to build.  In a Docker image, e.g. `spack/ubuntu-bionic`, where `cpio` is not installed, I'm getting the following error:

```console
[ubuntu] ~: spack install -d intel-mkl
...
There are one or more critical unresolved issues which prevent setup from
continuing.  Fix them and run the setup program again.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Missing critical prerequisite
-- 'cpio' tool could not be found
The setup program requires 'cpio' tool to complete installation. Please make
sure this tool is installed and its location is present in 'PATH' environment
variable.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
==> [2020-02-04-23:31:45.828090] WRITE LOCK: /super/absurdly/ridiculously/obnoxiously/long/path/for/relocation/.spack-db/prefix_lock[6645195540281252399:1] [Released]
==> [2020-02-04-23:31:45.828348] WRITE LOCK: /tmp/root/spack-stage/.lock[493556182836919143:1] [Released]
==> [2020-02-04-23:31:45.840027] Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 4:
    './install.sh' '--silent' 'silent.cfg'

1 warning found in build log:
  >> 4    WARNING: Destination directory already exists.
     5    
     6    There are one or more critical unresolved issues which prevent setup 
          from
     7    continuing.  Fix them and run the setup program again.
     8    ---------------------------------------------------------------------
          -----------
     9    Missing critical prerequisite
     10   -- 'cpio' tool could not be found

See build log for details:
  /tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-intel-mkl-2020.0.166-xbypirns6k2f5cow3wzxqa3aplktxpiv/spack-build-out.txt
...
```
